abstract: France acquits far-right National Front leader Marine Le Pen of charges that she incited religious hatred against Muslims with comments made at 2010 rally in Lyon.
lead_paragraph: Judges in Lyon said that comments the National Front leader made at a 2010 rally did not incite discrimination or violence against Muslims.

headline.main: French Court Acquits Marine Le Pen of Hate Speech
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; France: Court Acquits Le Pen of Inciting Hatred

snippet: Judges in Lyon said that comments the National Front leader made at a 2010 rally did not incite discrimination or violence against Muslims.
